H0.text: A hot plate, a beaker, and masking tape are the devices and instruments students will need to determine the boiling points of several aqueous solutions while wearing proper lab attire.

H1.text: Thermometer, hot plate, and beaker are the devices or instruments that students will need to conduct this experiment to determine the boiling points of several aqueous solutions, in addition to proper lab attire.

H2.text: Matches, a beaker, and a thermometer are the devices or instruments students need, in addition to proper lab attire, to determine the boiling points of several aqueous solutions.

H3.text: Balance, hot plate, and thermometer are the devices or instruments students need, in addition to proper lab attire, to conduct the experiment to determine the boiling points of several aqueous solutions.

A4.text: Cooking thermometers are important for determining if a food is properly cooked.

A5.text: Thermometers are important in food safety, where food at temperatures within 41 and 135 °F (5 and 57 °C) can be prone to potentially harmful levels of bacterial growth after several hours which could lead to foodborne illness.
